place_name: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library | South County Regional
place_description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.

reviews_data.review_text: This place has a nice calm atmosphere with nice and helpful librarians
An Jing You Shu Shi De Xue Xi Huan Jing .
The kids had a good time. They love library visits.

I just tried to go to storytime with my daughter at this location. We were late, as many families are with little children. I was told we couldn't go into the story time because it would be too disruptive to the other children. I then saw a woman exit storytime to take her child to the bathroom. No one told her she couldn't re-enter. Absolutely ridiculous, as this is the only location I have come across that does this. I have been to three other libraries in the area, all within the same system, and none of them have had an issue with people walking in late. Very disappointing. I will not be back.

This library is clean, well-organized, and staffed with helpful folks. Great for studying--quiet areas and free Wi-Fi--or grabbing books, movies, or kids' activities. They host free workshops and printing services, which is super convenient. Definitely recommend for anyone in the area.
Spacious and comfortable atmosphere. Wide and modern displays. Helpful, kind and polite staff.
Just perfect place for book lovers , can't ask for more
I got the card in just a few minutes. Great atmosphere and a large selection of books.
Creative programming, great layout, and super helpful and friendly staff!
Amazing facilities, Clean, welcoming staff, I love the audiobook options.

Beautiful building and had a kind staff member help me sign up for a card. Unfortunately the children's library area was disappointing.

I have a young child who cannot read yet, he can pick a few books and then wants to engage with other library activities while I browse for age appropriate stories for him and his sibling. At our previous libraries this involved Legos/duplos coloring pages, a white board with letter magnets and markers, computers etc etc. Here there was absolutely nothing for him to do the whole time. The computers were turned off for screen free Friday. There was a very fun looking play area that was closed and locked. There was a sign saying to put toys back but no toys aside from a few puppets and a board puzzle. No acknowledgement from a scowling librarian.

The only thing to do was play outside which I had to be outside with him and then could not browse the books. I have been to many libraries but never been to one with so little to do! Modern libraries should be a warm and fun place children look forward to visiting and then came home with armfuls of books. Not a boring place with all the fun locked off. If they are going to turn all the computers off and lock the play area they should be providing a variety of other activities in plain sight for children.
Very well situated. Peaceful. Great structure. Everything is arranged and tidy. Love the customer friendly staff. I highly recommend this to others!
excellent books

I tried to take my baby to story time and I was turned away because apparently it was "preschool story time" and he was too young. I saw other babies going in with older siblings. It's not easy getting out of the house with an infant early in the morning.
We go every two weeks and check out books. The boys love it!

4/23/2024: The South Charlotte public library at Pineville Matthew's and Rea Road is really quite good. Nice space, bright, good wifi.

The parking lot is a little odd. Just follow the arrows.

Note: There is a blood drive on April 30, 2024.
Went to this location to vote. It's a Mecklenburg county early voting site.

Nice library but the staff that's running the kids Dept are unnecessarily strict. I was a few min late for the preschool program and was not let in. They said it would be distracting. Mind you, kids in the program are participating loudly and interacting. No one would even know id went in to the room. The staff needs to understand that it's not always possible to get places on time when you have little ones. Be a bit more accommodating. It's book reading for kids, not a court hearing.
Awesome place. Thank you Charlotte for this peaceful and resourceful place.

Nice library, but the children's staff is unwelcoming and overly strict. Luckily, we live in close proximity to other branches where my child and I feel comfortable and can actually enjoy story time and our library experience.
Just made it very hard for people who are old, handicapped,  etc.. to vote.  Still about the same from the year before/
Love it here!

The library building itself is well designed. (Thanks to the architects and building planners that built it.) However, the staff and management over them are a bit slack. I was unable to study and concentrate because someone all the way on the opposite end of the library allowed their kids to "exercise" their vocal cords for a good 2 to 3 hours. And this was all in front a staff help desk not far away. And not a single one of these staff members did a thing about it. Don't believe me? Listen to the video clips I took and imagine trying to concentrate with that going on for a good 2 or 3 hours.
Well maintained and lots of books for small kids

Most of my experience with this location has been in the children's area. Storytime for the preschoolers is fun. It always starts with books and songs then ends with a craft. The staff working in this location (specifically in the children's area) are friendly, some are great with toddlers/preschoolers. The staff at the help desk right inside the door are not so friendly. They don't make eye contact. It is common courtesy to say hello or have a great day when people walk by you. I think we have had one, maybe two people out of our total visits acknowledge our existence. We have been attending storytime just about every week for several months.
Outstanding place to rent, I mean borrow a book. Used books for sale are overpriced!!!!

Pleasant, helpful staff. Lousy decor, much like an army barracks. Patrons are allowed to make phone calls, carry on conversations and kids play computer games talking to their friends at the next table with no restraint. Very intrusive when you're there to do serious work.
Amazing service great variety of books and enjoyable kids entertainment definitely recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Beautiful & silent place to read books, do your study or research.
Many places to sit & read....modern, bright, & easy to find the books you're looking for. Everyone who helped me was very nice. It's my new favorite place to hang out & read.

Don't believe the hours on their google listing.
Their not open Sunday and Monday.
I drove all the way there and they're closed.
For forbid they simply updated their hours, it's really not that hard.

Lots of space to find a quiet corner to work or read. If you're a tutor this is a great place for that. The kids section has a lot to offer for children including media resources, puzzles, etc. There's even a dedicated teen area that has age/time restrictions. This is a very clean and beautiful facility and there are even community rooms you can reserve for larger group meetings.

I honestly had a great time here with my family. I have not been to them all just yet but so far this is my favorite one. There's so many spots to chill and do school work and work period. The staff is very friendly and helpful its clean and beautiful inside. If you want a library to call home So far I say choose this one. This one will always be in my top three.
They have a good selection.

South county Mecklenburg Library, right here near trader Joe on Rea Road. This place reminds me why I fell in love with Charlotte. There's a reading area for kids and teens communication room, book clubs, makers room, computer rooms and cafe area...too many to list!! I also have to give 6 stars to service because I got my library card in less than 15minutes!!  Come and find yourself a spot to enjoy your book elegantly.
Very popular library. Good selection, helpful staff. Probably my favorite in the area.

This was my first time to this location and it was horrible! Almost everyone I interacted with was dismissive and borderline rude.

The two ladies at the front desk couldn't have cared less and where definitely afraid of me. When I was on the second floor I was at the another counter where 4 people were hanging out and I waited there for about a minute and NO ONE , not a ONE, acknowledged me. I walked to the other side, where the print release station is and finally someone helped give me a guess pass. When I needed to print and the tap-to-pay wasn't working I got help but she was mean as all heck.

I know it's the south but I shouldn't be treated like I'm not there or like I'm subhuman because I'm different.

I always go to the Plaza Midwood Library and never have this experience. This location would do well to practice tolerance the way we do back there.

After coming to this library for over a year 2-3 times a week I can confidently say that this is a very nice and comfortable space with great internet and more than enough electrical outlets if needed. The chairs are comfortable and there is nice big windows for natural light. The only thing that brings this down is the fact that it is the noisiest library I have ever been in. Headphones or earbuds are an absolute must and even with them you can hear conversations. Even in the so called "quiet study" room conversations can be heard. This is not simply the people in the library but the workers as well that can often be found huddled and chatting loudly. If it wasn't for the noise this would be a 5 star library but it is simply too loud.
Best place to study and read
Peaceful, clean, welcoming staff.
Very friendly staff over the phone and in person. Great study rooms.
Nice place to read,have a large collection of books,nice reading rooms and study rooms,nice ambience...best place in Charlotte
Always my go to place for quite reading and inspirational books.
Beautiful facility since the remodel. Always love coming to the library just to sit and work bills and budgeting...it helps me concentrate!
Beautiful library, easy to check out books automatically. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean, plenty of seats.
Nice Staff, lots of room to read and high variety of books.
The staff is very helpful and willing to answer any questions. Quick return through the side of the building. Easy checkout. Very good selection for children. Would highly recommend.
Tons of seating and desks for studying. Not typically crowded. Everything appears brand new. It's so nice in there!

Very clean facility with an efficient process for checking out. The children's section was easy to navigate, with clear posts/labels so each child could identify where to get books for their reading level.

With all that money and time it took to renovate, you should have stocked books instead.  Two well known authors I looked for and are never available.   You may have two books from the same author and the others will have to come from a different library.   I will go to Matthews instead.  Like the old look a lot better.  Sad....
There was a recent renovation of this branch and now it looks super nice! The staff is always helpful. They keep the place clean and tidy. Thank you so much to make it such a great regional library.
My family experiences was above out expectation. The service and staff A one. I would recommend this learning facility to family and friends.
It was great! I had a book that I put on hold and I couldn't find it and they went into the back room to retrieve it after the transfer. Wonderful service, kind people!
Outstanding
We Love the Library!

If you are a student looking for a good place to do school or study, this place is perfect! Has a lot of great space to sit and work, as well as lots of charging ports at almost every table! The new removations are great and added way more space for people! There are about 4 different sections with tables upstairs, downstairs is more for kids, so it wont be as quiet. I do Suggest coming between 9:00am-2:00pm, that is when it will be less packed and noisy!

Though the new library looks nice and bright, I'm not sure it's much of an improvement over the old one because the amount of quiet space has been significantly reduced. This includes the half of the second floor that was completely quiet before and no longer is.
We moved and found this library, great selections for all ages!

They spent the last year or so re-designing the whole building....and the new design is awful! It was re-built during the pandemic, and so the new design is specifically geared towards the pandemic condition. They have installed a bunch of rooms where there used to be open space, so that people can better isolate themselves from others. This also makes the library feel cramped, even though its a huge building. The lovely garden on the downstairs patio is now gone, and they have left only a tiny fraction of space for a new garden. The children's area is likewise now cramped and has hardly any open space.
The staff was friendly and very helpful. I really appreciate their service and their help. Thank you.

I came here when I had to cram for a math exam to get into college. They had wonderful reference books for calculus and that was beyond helpful. I found the upstairs area very peaceful and very relaxing area for even a very stressful thing! Wifi is incredibly fast, and I will definitely be coming back soon! For anyone wondering, they also have a section for LGBTQ+ reference and content that is of a decent size.

Newly renovated, this library has such a nice modern and clean look to it. Plenty of computers and desks available to use and a friendly and helpful staff, though that you will find at any of the Charlotte Mecklenburg libraries.

This is a beautiful Library. We are fortunate to have this facility where we can once again go and spend quiet time to read, to study and just enjoy the beauty of the Library and surroundings.
Courteous staff. Easy access to this Library.
Our new favorite library!!!

Very nice building and good collection of books. Great and super helpful librarians.

Extra pleased that they have all covid-19 restrictions in place to ensure library is safe for everyone and help stop spread of the disease.
It's an exciting renewed space!  Come check it out. Traffic pattern in the parking lot is different, but I think it's an improvement.

I haven't been to this establishment since before they remodeled and I was not disappointed when I visited today. They had someone going around wiping surfaces whether they were just doing regular cleaning or not that is something you don't really see anywhere. I needed help finding cook books and a gentleman showed me where they were and was very helpful! The place looks amazing and everyone was super friendly!

The library renovation were well worth the wait. Clean facility and spacious reading areas. Some of the seating areas are still blocked off on the second floor. There's a lot of natural light from the windows and several computers for self checkout.
Excellent staff and the beautiful building makes it welcoming to all.

(Masks Required): My visit was pleasant and the librarians were very friendly. They greeted me when I walked in and I told them how I hadn't been there since they remodeled so one of the librarians gave me a quick tour where she explained and pointed out the update of what has changed. Social distancing is in place as even though at the time that I visited it was only myself and two other people in there and I only was in there all of 10mins. They have self checkout and if you need to use the computer to print since they are in Level 2 status right now there is no fee to print and they will give you a guest pass to do so, so you will only really need your library card to scan to check out . Would highly recommend this library without any reservations to you and your family!
This library is a great place to visit, with lots of books, computers, and friendly people.

Really underwhelmed with the new library update. Every library they've updated feels kind of sparse and feels cheap.  As a tax payer I'm not impressed. I'm also not thrilled with the covid restrictions they've enacted. There's zero places to sit now, and they've coraled everything off that makes the library fun and interesting. I'm not sure at what point our libraries will be more welcoming to the public. However as business have shown it can be done safely, so the library should follow suit.

Libraries are supposed to be quiet! The patrons and the staff are entirely too loud. If you MUST talk keep it at a soft whisper. No one should be using their normal voices to talk to someone right next to them.  The Plaza Library enforces volume which I appreciate but this branch doesn't. Very annoying.

I don't know if I came on a bad day, but as a former library assistant, I was really disappointed. The people who worked there were nice... to their coworkers. They seemed uninterested in helping the public, and I had to point out how one could use the non-resident card (you CAN check out regular books with it, no matter what they say) to the staff at the circulation desk. Customer service was nonexistent, which surprised me, because it was everything at the small rural library system I worked at. Their books were poorly shelved, which was disappointing for such a large library. The children's area was nice, but I really didn't feel comfortable with the children's librarians scowling at me. If I felt that way as a 37 year old woman, I can only imagine how the kids must feel. No one feels approachable here. Honestly, I bought the non-resident card to get access to a larger amount of books, but from here on out, I'll only visit the library to pick up holds. I won't come here to spend some time, we'll go to our own dinky library for that. At least the people at ours seem happy to see us.
Incredible knowledge contained within this facility, staff and in the stacks!
The best library I have ever seen. Thank you for that library!!!!!!!
A great array of books and programs for children.

Took my 4 year old and infant to the library today to get out of the house. We went to the children's section and my daughter quickly found other kids to play with. There was about 5 of them. They were having a good time playing with the hand puppets and got a little too excited and started chasing each other in a circle in a small area- again in the KID'S section. An older woman who worked there quickly came over and started scolding the kids for running and saying "if you need to run so bad have your parents take you to the park" mind you it was about to storm outside but that's besides the point. Basically, yes they should not have been running and yes a library is not a place for that kind of play but the librarian could have at least given them a warning first before the harsh words or picked a nicer approach to her message such as letting the parents know they need to settle down. These kids were all under the age of 5. Will not be returning.

Because of fresh hip surgery I am using a rolling walker and am rather unstable. So at this Library I went to use the automatic door openers and none of them worked. The person next to me tried them too and after he pushed the square buttons, the doors didn't open for him either. So he helped me on the way in. Leaving, I went through the door alone and shoved it open but it came back quick and hit me and knocked me over but it was a good thing the person coming thru the other way caught me. If he hadn't, I'd now be visiting DeMayo Law. Hey, CML, fix it!!
Love it . There are a lot of selections.
Staff was unhelpful and literally rolled their eyes at me when I asked for help with copying. Unprofessional and rude. Will not be returning.
Love it.

A good branch with nice staff, wide selection that you can also borrow from around the library system.  My only complaint is that it is fairly regular that my returns (especiallyCDs) are not checked back in the same day, resulting in fines.
Books are not checked-in carefully at this branch, both the book drop and in-person. After multiple errors, I now only return materials to the Matthews location.

Library building is decent size for branch library.
Staff is polite enough.
Kids section was full of kids but it's on the first floor, not so noisy but there's no dedicated quiet study room.
Pretty nice location.  Great inventory, very helpful staff, and easy parking.  Tons of tables and seating for quiet reading, study or work.
A peaceful place to read and ponder. Been coming here since it was built.

I wouldn't come back. Me and my daughter came for toddler story time and we drove 30 minutes to get here so we were about 5 minutes late but they said story time had been closed and we weren't aloud to join. We are pretty upset.

One of the only public libraries where there is an actual designated space for people actually trying to do work, not just sit and chat and watch YouTube. Very clean, nice staff, and they have power outlets everywhere, something other libraries just don't seem to have.
Helpful, friendly staff. Nice facility.
Good game I rate 20/10
Nice staff.  Quite place.

Moved from Massachusetts, can't believe they charge for newer movie, in Massachusetts everything is free. The difference is the newer movie would only allow 7days rental than 14days, and the penalty is only $0.2
Bu Cuo
they have terrible internet connection and there's not enough places to sit.
Library wi-fi is very slow and inconvenient.
Very nice, clean, quite place to read with comfortable chair and table.
The staff made you feel welcome! Helped me through my entire visit! Very satisfied!

I love this library. Quiet areas for reading or studying. Great book selections for adults and children. Computers are available to use if needed.The library is always clean and has plenty of friendly staff to help with questions.
This place is great! With lots of peace and quiet, and great books, u can spend all day reading

I'm new to the Charlotte area but this is the most rowdy library I have ever been in, especially when the teenagers come out the Catholic High School around the corner. Libraries used to be quiet; not anymore! Its so congested. I would give you 1 star, but I'm being nice today :)
This is a very nice facility. Clean and quiet, helpful staff, plenty of selection. I also love the self check-out, for days when I just want books without human interaction.
Great place to study....and great and courteous staff.
Really great place and layout. I love studying there. I know its government thing but wish library can open longer on weekend.
Great place to learn without spending a fortune buying.
The library is a magical place.
Great place to study
This library is nice and all but the ability to do much of anything on the wifi is limited. It blocks a lot of websites and services. That said, the selection of books is top notch.
